text.50_Chapter, 28_Verse: My soul shall rejoice in my age (or his praise); And ye shall not be ashamed of my song.
text.37_Chapter, 17_Verse: Out of sorrow (?) cometh harm; So the sad of heart buildeth up trouble (?).
text.49_Chapter, 15_Verse: And they sounded, and made their glorious voice heard; To bring to remembrance (?) before the Most High.
text.2_Chapter, 8_Verse: The blessing of a father settleth the root; But the curse of a mother plucketh up the plant.
text.6_Chapter, 9_Verse: Be not impatient (H short) in prayer; And in almsgiving hesitate not (?).
text.49_Chapter, 22_Verse: May he give you wisdom of heart; And may there be (?) peace among you.
text.29_Chapter, 10_Verse: Let him not have rule in his youth; And bear not with his mischiefs.
text.30_Chapter, 1_Verse:
Care for sustenance breaketh off slumber; And sore sickness (M) dissipateth slumber.
Reproach putteth to flight a faithful friend; But he that hideth a secret is beloved (?) as one's soul.
text.11_Chapter, 24_Verse: He will shake his head, and wave his hand; And with much whispering (?) he will change his countenance.
text.14_Chapter, 11_Verse: Lest thou say, He it was that made me stumble; For there is no need of men of violence.
text.3_Chapter, 24_Verse: Gainsay not the truth (H God); And submit thyself unto God.
text.50_Chapter, 19_Verse:
I gave my soul after her; And for ever and ever I will not swerveâ€¦ My hand opened her gates; And I looked for her (?), and beheld her (S);
And in pureness I found her. And I gat me (?) understanding from her beginning; Therefore........
text.3_Chapter, 25_Verse: Be not ashamed to turn from iniquity; And stand not against a stream.
text.12_Chapter, 16_Verse: How should there be (?) peace between hyena and dog? How should there be peace between rich and poor?
text.6_Chapter, 5_Verse: Lest thou fear the person of the noble; And suffer lucre to corrupt thine integrity (?).
text.13_Chapter, 15_Verse:
Give to a brother (H), and let thy soul fare delicately; For there is no seeking of luxury in Sheol.
And whatsoever thing is seemly to do; Do it before (?) God.
text.33_Chapter, 19_Verse: Mercy from the Lord in time (?) of affliction Is as cloud (?) of rains in season of drought.
text.6_Chapter, 1_Verse: Sow not upon the furrows of unrighteousness (?); Lest thou reap it sevenfold.
text.12_Chapter, 10_Verse:
Make not bold to be free (?) with him; And mistrust thou his much talk.
For with his much talk maketh he trial of thee; And he will smile upon thee, and search thee out.
text.14_Chapter, 15_Verse: Fire and water are poured out before thee: Upon whichsoever thou choosest stretch forth thy hands.
text.31_Chapter, 23_Verse: He that observeth the law keepeth his soul; And he that trusteth in the Lord shall not be ashamed.
text.31_Chapter, 0_Verse: Be to them as one of them; Take thought for them, and afterward be seated: Supply their want, and afterward recline.
text.30_Chapter, 4_Verse: He that pursueth after gold shall not be innocent; And he that loveth hire shall err thereby.
text.34_Chapter, 5_Verse: Wake up indignation, and pour out wrath; And subdue the foe, and drive away (?) the enemy.
text.34_Chapter, 15_Verse: And let all the ends of the earth know (H), That thou art our God for ever (?).
text.12_Chapter, 8_Verse: Doth a noble draw near? be thou distant; And so much the more he will approach thee.
text.15_Chapter, 18_Verse: The roots also of the mountains and the foundations of the world, When he looketh upon them, quake exceedingly.
text.5_Chapter, 32_Verse: If thou art wishful to hear (H); And incline thine ear (H), thou shalt be instructed.
text.31_Chapter, 9_Verse:
Before hail (H) speedeth (?) lightning; And before one that is downcast speedeth favour.
Before hail (H) speedeth (?) lightning; And before one that is shamefast favour.
text.5_Chapter, 6_Verse: Hast thou gotten a friend? get him in trial (?); And be not in haste to trust on him.
text.50_Chapter, 29_Verse:
Work your works in righteousness; And he shall give you your reward in his season.
Blessed is the Lord for ever; And praised be his name to generation and generation.
text.12_Chapter, 21_Verse: A poor man speaketh (G S), and they hoot at him (?); Though he be wise that speaketh, there is no place for him.
text.31_Chapter, 7_Verse: Restrain speaking, and diminish it exceedingly; And be like to one that knoweth and holdeth his tongue.
text.5_Chapter, 8_Verse: There is a friend that turneth to an enemy; And he will make bare the strife to thy reproach.
text.29_Chapter, 23_Verse: Joy of heart, that is the life of a man; And a man's cheerfulness lengthens his days (G).
text.13_Chapter, 4_Verse: He that is evil to himself, to whom will he be good? And he will not enjoy (?) his own goods.
text.49_Chapter, 25_Verse: The inhabitants of Seir and Philistia; And the foolish nation that dwelleth in Sichem.
text.49_Chapter, 12_Verse: With the fire-offerings of the Lord in their hand, Before all the congregation of Israel.
text.29_Chapter, 27_Verse: The sleep of a good heart is instead of dainties; And his food is agreeable unto him.
text.34_Chapter, 12_Verse: Give testimony to the firstling of thy works; And establish the vision spoken in thy name.
text.36_Chapter, 33_Verse: Be not insatiable (G) for every luxury; And be not effuse on all dainties.
text.4_Chapter, 16_Verse: Honour and disgrace are in the hand (?) of talk; And the tongue of a man is his fall.
text.33_Chapter, 13_Verse: He will not reject the cry of the fatherless; And of the widow, when she maketh much complaint (H).
text.31_Chapter, 11_Verse: ..in thy heart (?), and do pleasure; In the fear of God, and not with lack of understanding (H all).
text.14_Chapter, 14_Verse:
If thou choose, thou mayest keep the commandment; And it is understanding (H) to do his will.
If thou trust in him, thou shalt even live.
text.13_Chapter, 5_Verse: There is none more evil than he that is evil to himself; And he hath with him the recompense of his wickedness.
text.11_Chapter, 9_Verse: Never trust an enemy; For like as brass his wickedness cankereth.
text.37_Chapter, 10_Verse: Offer a sweet savour (?) as a memorial; And fatness estimated according to thy substance (?).
text.12_Chapter, 6_Verse: So long as it profiteth he will cajole thee. Twice or thrice he will shew thee reverence (?); And then he will look at thee and pass thee by (?); And will wag his head at thee.
text.33_Chapter, 15_Verse: Bitterness that is well-pleasing (H) is her lamentation (?): Her (G His) cry hasteth to the clouds.
text.34_Chapter, 16_Verse: The throat eateth every meat; Yet is one meat more pleasant than another (M).
text.4_Chapter, 12_Verse: Be not winnowing with every wind, And turning the way of the stream (H).
text.15_Chapter, 16_Verse:
Say not, I am hidden from God; And who shall remember me on high?
In the mass of people I shall not be known; And what is my soul at the end of the spirits of all the sons of men?
text.3_Chapter, 6_Verse: Incline thine ear to the poor; And answer him Peace with meekness.
text.5_Chapter, 12_Verse: Separate thyself from thine enemies; And beware of thy friends.
text.31_Chapter, 10_Verse:
At the appointed time tarry not; Get thee home and do pleasure (?).
At table time multiply not words; Even though a thing hath come into thy mind.
text.12_Chapter, 4_Verse: If thou have substance (?), he will speak thee fair; And he will impoverish thee, and will not be sorry.
text.6_Chapter, 6_Verse: Condemn not thyself in the congregation at the gate (?); And cast not thyself down in the assembly.
text.4_Chapter, 10_Verse: For suddenly shall his indignation go forth; And in the day of vengeance thou shalt perish.
text.32_Chapter, 2_Verse: A man of discernment discerneth a matter; And his law....... *******
text.29_Chapter, 16_Verse:
Better is to die than a life of vanity; And eternal rest than continual pain.
Better is to die than life that is evil; And to go down to Sheol than lasting pain.
text.37_Chapter, 9_Verse: Flee from iniquity, and from respect of persons; And from all transgressions cleanse thy heart.
text.3_Chapter, 28_Verse: Unto death contend (?) for justice; And the Lord shall fight for thee.
text.15_Chapter, 24_Verse: I will pour forth my spirit by weight; And with carefulness will I declare my opinion.
text.50_Chapter, 18_Verse: My soul longed for her; And I would not turn my face from her.
text.15_Chapter, 12_Verse: He will not (M) let the wrong-doer escape with plunder; Neither will he frustrate the desire of the righteous for ever.
text.3_Chapter, 31_Verse: Be not as a dog (G lion) in thine house; And strange and fearful in thy business.
text.5_Chapter, 21_Verse: For discipline is according to its (?) name; And to the more part she is not plain (or right).
text.50_Chapter, 27_Verse: Hear, ye many (?), my teaching in my youth; And ye shall get silver and gold by me.
text.13_Chapter, 8_Verse: In the eye of a fool (S) his portion is small; But he that taketh his neighbour's portion wasteth his own (?).
text.11_Chapter, 13_Verse: Set him not on thy right hand: Wherefore should he seek thy seat?
text.11_Chapter, 2_Verse: No good cometh of bestowing upon (?) him that is wicked; And (?) that hath not done righteousness.
text.4_Chapter, 2_Verse: Go not after thy heart and thine eyes; To walk in the pleasures of wickedness.
text.49_Chapter, 26_Verse:
The instruction of understanding and proverbs fitly spoken (?) Of Simon, son of Jesus, son of Eleazar, son of Sira.
Whose heart prophesied as with a harp (?); And who poured forth understanding.
text.4_Chapter, 6_Verse: Trust not to forgiveness; To add iniquity to iniquity.
text.30_Chapter, 9_Verse:
Who is he? that we may cleave (H) unto him; And he shall have peace, and he shall have glory.
For when as the peace of his life multiplieth, I will be a glory unto thee (?).
text.11_Chapter, 8_Verse: In a man's prosperity even an enemy is a friend; And in his adversity even a friend separateth himself.
text.3_Chapter, 1_Verse: Vex not the spirit (?) of the soul that lacketh; And hide not thyself from one that is crushed (?) in soul.
text.3_Chapter, 22_Verse: Withhold not a word (or to speak) in season (?); Nor ever conceal thy wisdom.
text.29_Chapter, 26_Verse: Envy and sorrow (G wrath) shorten days; And care maketh old untimely.
text.49_Chapter, 9_Verse: As a green olive full of berries; And as a wild olive tree with branches full of sap.
text.3_Chapter, 26_Verse: Lay not thyself down for a fool to tread upon; And be not contrary before rulers.
text.50_Chapter, 10_Verse:
I will praise thy name continually; And I will remember thee with prayer.
Then the Lord heard my voice; And gave ear unto my supplication.
text.3_Chapter, 15_Verse: For I will go with him, making myself strange; And at the first I (H he) will try him with temptations.
text.37_Chapter, 7_Verse: That his work may not fail (?); Nor health from among the sons of men (M his earth).
text.37_Chapter, 11_Verse: And to the physician also give (?) a place; And he shall not remove, for there is need of him likewise.
text.49_Chapter, 10_Verse:
When he put on robes of honour; And clothed himself with robes of beauty.
When he ascended the altar of majesty; And made glorious the precinct of the sanctuary.
text.49_Chapter, 20_Verse: And they bowed down again a second time, The people all of them, before him.
text.50_Chapter, 0_Verse:
I will praise thee, O God of my salvation; I will give thanks unto thee (?), my God, my Father; I will declare thy name, O stronghold of my life.
For thou hast redeemed my soul from death.
text.6_Chapter, 8_Verse: Loathe not appointed service of laborious work; For it hath been apportioned of God (?).
text.5_Chapter, 0_Verse: Reproach shall inherit (H) an evil name and disgrace: So an evil man that is a double dealer.
text.50_Chapter, 26_Verse: See with your eyes that I was a little one; And I laboured (G S) in her and found her.
text.31_Chapter, 17_Verse: A wise man will not take a bribe (H): One that is proud and a scorner will not keep the law.
text.5_Chapter, 18_Verse: As one that plougheth and as one that reapeth approach unto her; And wait for the abundance of her increase. For in the tillage of her thou shalt toil a little; And on the morrow (H) thou shalt eat her fruit.
text.49_Chapter, 14_Verse: Then sounded the sons of Aaron, the priests, With trumpets of turnery.
text.12_Chapter, 9_Verse: Come not near, lest thou be put far off; And stand not far off, lest thou be forgotten (G).
text.4_Chapter, 0_Verse: Stay not upon thy strength (or wealth); And say not, It is in the power of my hand.
text.48_Chapter, 14_Verse: Like Joseph was ever a man born? And also his body was visited.
text.11_Chapter, 11_Verse: Be to him as one that revealeth a mystery (H S); And he shall not find opportunity to harm thee. And know thou the end of jealousy (H S).
text.12_Chapter, 13_Verse: All flesh loveth its kind; And every man him that is like unto him.
text.34_Chapter, 14_Verse: Hear the prayer of thy servants; According to thy good pleasure (?) unto thy people.
text.12_Chapter, 19_Verse: A rich man when he is shaken is held up (?) of a friend; But the poor when he is shaken is thrust from evil to evil (?).
text.2_Chapter, 30_Verse: Whoso doeth good, it shall meet him in his ways (?); And in the time that he tottereth he shall find a stay.
text.5_Chapter, 3_Verse: For fierce appetite corrupteth them that have it; And the joy of an enemy overtaketh (H) them.
text.12_Chapter, 17_Verse: Wild asses of the wilderness are food for the lion: So the poor are the prey of the rich.
text.14_Chapter, 13_Verse: For (?) God created man from the beginning; And put him into the hand of him that would spoil him; And gave him into the hand of his inclination.
text.48_Chapter, 13_Verse: Few have been created upon the earth like Enoch (?); And he also was taken within (?).
text.36_Chapter, 31_Verse: My son, prove thy soul in thy life (M in wine); And see thou give it not that which is bad for it.
text.5_Chapter, 34_Verse: See who (?) hath understanding, and seek him early; And let thy foot wear my (H) threshold.
text.6_Chapter, 17_Verse: Exchange not a friend at a price; Neither a brother that is attached (or doubted) for gold of Ophir.
text.14_Chapter, 16_Verse: Death and life are before a man: That which he shall choose shall be given him.
text.6_Chapter, 12_Verse: Love not to make any manner of (?) lie; For the consequence (H hope) thereof shall not be pleasant.
text.13_Chapter, 18_Verse: All his works shall surely rot; And his handywork shall draw after him.
text.15_Chapter, 15_Verse: Whose works are manifest under heaven; His mercies are seen of all his creatures; And his light and his darkness (?) hath he apportioned to the sons of men.
text.13_Chapter, 23_Verse: He that encampeth about her house; And driveth his pegs (?) into her wall.
text.12_Chapter, 15_Verse: What fellowship shall wolf have with lamb? Such is the wicked to the righteous; And so is the rich unto a man that is destitute.
text.2_Chapter, 22_Verse: And intrude not into that which is beyond thee; For thou hast been shewed that which is too great for thee.
text.36_Chapter, 35_Verse: By intemperance many perish utterly (?); But he that taketh heed shall add to life.
text.36_Chapter, 34_Verse: For in much luxury (M food) nesteth sickness; And he that surfeiteth shall come nigh to loathing.
text.2_Chapter, 9_Verse: Take not honour to thyself by the shame of thy father; For it is no honour unto thee.
text.13_Chapter, 0_Verse: Happy is the man whom his own mouth hath not troubled; And whose heart hath not condemned him (?).
text.5_Chapter, 28_Verse: And her net shall be to thee a strong defence; And her cordage robes of fine gold.
text.11_Chapter, 16_Verse: So is he that joineth himself to an impious man (G S), And walloweth in his iniquities.
text.30_Chapter, 8_Verse: Who is he? and we will call him blessed: For he hath done wonderously among his people.
text.4_Chapter, 7_Verse: Nor say, His mercy is great: He will forgive the multitude of mine iniquities.
text.15_Chapter, 7_Verse: And he spared not them that sojourned with Lot (?), Who transgressed in their pride.
text.11_Chapter, 20_Verse: So long as thou standest (?), he will not shew himself; And if thou (G) totter, he will not bear up.
text.3_Chapter, 17_Verse: If he turn away and decline from me (?), I will train him with fetters (or restraints).
text.5_Chapter, 26_Verse: Search and examine, seek and find; And hold her fast, and let her not go.
text.5_Chapter, 5_Verse: Be they that are at peace with thee many; But he that hath thy secret one of a thousand.
text.30_Chapter, 5_Verse:
Many are there that have been given in pledge (?) to gold; And that trusted (?) on rubies.
And they found not how to escape from evil; Neither to save themselves in the day of wrath.
text.13_Chapter, 16_Verse: All flesh waxeth old as a garment; And the everlasting decree is, They shall surely perish.
text.6_Chapter, 15_Verse: Abase pride very exceedingly; For the hope of man is the worm (H S).
text.5_Chapter, 10_Verse: In thy prosperity he is as thou art; And in thine adversity he will remove away from thee.
text.50_Chapter, 7_Verse:
And I remembered the mercies of the Lord; And his lovingkindnesses which are from everlasting.
He that delivereth them that trust in him; And redeemeth them from all evil.
text.37_Chapter, 3_Verse: God bringeth out medicines from the earth; And let a prudent man not refuse them.
text.5_Chapter, 15_Verse: A faithful friend is a balm (G S) of life; He that feareth God shall obtain it.
text.5_Chapter, 27_Verse: For afterward thou shalt find her rest; And she (?) shall turn to a delight unto thee.
text.37_Chapter, 19_Verse: Remember his sentence, for it is thy sentence; His yesterday, and thine to day.
text.49_Chapter, 23_Verse:
May his mercy stand fast with Simon; And may he confirm to him the covenant of Phinehas,
Which he executed (?) unto him and unto his seed, As the days of heaven.
text.15_Chapter, 17_Verse: Behold, the heaven, and the heaven of heavens, And the deep, and the earth; When he descendeth upon them, they tremble (?), At his visitation (?), and when he rageth.
text.49_Chapter, 2_Verse: In whose days a wall was built; A bulwark of refuge (?) in the temple of the King.
text.14_Chapter, 19_Verse:
He commanded not a man to sin; Neither did he make men of falsehood to dream.
And he hath no mercy on him that worketh vanity; And on him that discloseth a secret.
text.12_Chapter, 12_Verse: Take heed and beware; And go not with men of violence.
text.2_Chapter, 23_Verse: For many are the conceits of the sons of men; And the imaginations of thoughts (H) that make them to err.
text.15_Chapter, 13_Verse: Whosoever doeth righteousness, there is a reward for him; And according to his works shall every man go forth (H) before him.
text.6_Chapter, 7_Verse: Conspire not to commit a second sin; For in one thou shalt not be unpunished.
text.12_Chapter, 3_Verse: If thou be right for him, he will make thee serve him; And if thou be brought low, he will be sparing of thee.
text.14_Chapter, 8_Verse: Praise is not comely (G S) in the mouth of the wicked; For it was not apportioned him of God.
text.5_Chapter, 11_Verse: If evil overtake thee, he will turn against thee; And will hide himself from thy face.
text.3_Chapter, 8_Verse: Be as a father to orphans; And instead of a husband to widows.
text.30_Chapter, 3_Verse:
The poor toileth for the lack of his house; And if he rest, he becometh needy.
The labour of the poor is for the lack of his means (?); And if he rest, it is to his lamentation (or he is distressed).
text.31_Chapter, 22_Verse: In all thy doings keep thy soul; For he that doeth this keepeth a commandment.
text.31_Chapter, 2_Verse: Speak, O elder, for it pertaineth to thee; And be carefully wise (?), and hinder not song.
text.49_Chapter, 19_Verse:
Then he came down, and lifted up his hands Over all the congregation of Israel.
And the blessing of the Lord was on his lips; And in the name of the Lord he gloried.
text.33_Chapter, 9_Verse: Give to God (?) according as he hath given to thee; With goodness of eye, and as thy hand hath found (?).
text.12_Chapter, 11_Verse: He that is cruel will speak peace (?) and spare not; While he plotteth a plot against the life of many.
text.13_Chapter, 21_Verse: Going forth after her in search of her; And spying all her entries.
text.3_Chapter, 20_Verse: For there is a shame (?) that ladeth with iniquity; And there is a shame that is honour and grace.
text.48_Chapter, 15_Verse: And Shem and Seth and Enosh were visited (H); And above every living thing was the glory of Adam.
text.31_Chapter, 14_Verse: He that seeketh the law shall obtain her; And he that is a madman shall be snared thereby.
text.37_Chapter, 14_Verse: He that sinneth against his Maker Will behave himself proudly (H) against a physician.
text.3_Chapter, 10_Verse: Wisdom teacheth (H) her sons; And testifieth (H) to all that attend to her.
text.6_Chapter, 0_Verse: Do not evil to thyself, and evil shall not (?) overtake thee; Keep far from iniquity, and it shall turn aside from thee.
text.33_Chapter, 11_Verse:
Bribe (S Hesitate) not, for he will not receive; And trust not upon a sacrifice of oppression.
For he is a God of judgement; And with him is no respect of persons.
text.15_Chapter, 3_Verse: Of one that (?) feareth the Lord shall a city be peopled; And by a family of transgressors it shall be made desolate.
text.3_Chapter, 18_Verse: If he turn away from after me, I will cast him off, and deliver him to the spoilers.
text.36_Chapter, 32_Verse: For not all is good for all: Not every soul chooseth every sort.
text.3_Chapter, 27_Verse: Sit not with one that judgeth unrighteously; For according to his pleasure (?) thou shalt judge with him.
text.2_Chapter, 7_Verse: My son, in word and in deed honour thy father; That all blessings may overtake thee.
text.13_Chapter, 26_Verse: And he sheltereth in her shade from the heat; And will dwell in her habitations.
text.37_Chapter, 18_Verse: Set not the heart upon him (M) any more; Dismiss his remembrance, and remember the end.
text.29_Chapter, 12_Verse: Chastise (or Train) thy son, and make his yoke heavy; Lest in his folly he lift himself up (M) against thee.
text.5_Chapter, 20_Verse: As a burdensome weight shall she be upon him; And he will not tarry to cast her away.
text.31_Chapter, 13_Verse:
He that seeketh God will receive discipline; And he that seeketh him diligently shall obtain an answer.
He that seeketh things pleasing to God shall receive instruction; And he will answer him in his prayer.
text.49_Chapter, 18_Verse:
And all the people of the land chanted, In prayer before the Merciful.
Until he finished serving the altar; And had brought its customary offerings unto it.
text.6_Chapter, 4_Verse: Seek not to be a ruler; If thou hast not ability to quell pride.
text.50_Chapter, 24_Verse: I opened my mouth and spake of her, Get ye wisdom in possession without money.
text.37_Chapter, 24_Verse: He is busied with oxen, and leadeth about cattle (?); And his discourses are with bullocks.
text.4_Chapter, 15_Verse: If it be in thee, answer thy neighbour; And if not, be thy hand upon thy mouth.
text.33_Chapter, 17_Verse:
Yea, and God will not tarry; And as a mighty man he will not refrain himself:
Till he smite the loins of the unmerciful; And repay vengeance to the heathen:
Till he dispossess the sceptre of pride; And quite cut down the rod of the wicked:
text.32_Chapter, 0_Verse: Evil shall not befall him that feareth the Lord; But in temptation even again he shall be delivered (?).
text.50_Chapter, 9_Verse:
And I exalted the Lord, saying, Thou art my Father; For thou art the mighty one of my salvation.
Leave me not in the day of trouble; In the day of wasteness and desolation.
text.14_Chapter, 4_Verse: And she shall exalt him above his neighbour; And in the midst of the congregation shall she open his mouth.
text.5_Chapter, 36_Verse: And he shall make thy heart discerning (H); And make thee wise according as thou desirest.
text.5_Chapter, 7_Verse: For there is a friend that is for a season; And that will not (?) continue in the day of affliction.
text.31_Chapter, 8_Verse: Among elders set not thyself up; And press not (?) much on princes.
text.49_Chapter, 5_Verse: As the morning star from amid thick clouds; And as the full moon in the days of (?) the solemn feast.
text.12_Chapter, 20_Verse: The rich speaketh, and his helpers are many; And his unseemly words are overlaid (?).
text.5_Chapter, 33_Verse: Be desirous to hear all discourse; And let no proverb of understanding escape thee.
text.13_Chapter, 12_Verse: Do good to a friend before thou die; And as thy hand attaineth (?) give unto him.
text.50_Chapter, 8_Verse: And I lifted up my voice from the earth; And from the gates of Sheol I cried.
text.33_Chapter, 16_Verse:
The crying of the poor passeth through thick clouds (M); And resteth not until it come nigh.
It will not remove till God shall visit; And till he that judgeth righteously shall do judgement.
text.2_Chapter, 10_Verse: The honour of his father is a man's honour; And he that curseth his mother doth greatly sin.
text.37_Chapter, 5_Verse: And he gave man understanding; To glory in his (M their) might.
text.5_Chapter, 31_Verse: If thou be desirous, my son, thou mayest become wise; And if thou apply thy heart, thou shalt be prudent.
text.29_Chapter, 13_Verse: Better is one that is poor, and healthy in his body; Than a rich man that is plagued in his flesh.
text.12_Chapter, 22_Verse: When the rich speaketh, all keep silence; And (?) they extol his wisdom to the clouds.
text.6_Chapter, 2_Verse: Seek not of God dominion; Nor likewise of a king a seat of honour.
text.6_Chapter, 23_Verse: Hast thou daughters? guard their flesh; And make not thy face bright unto them.
text.33_Chapter, 14_Verse: Do not tears run down the cheek? Doth she not sigh because of her miseries?
text.49_Chapter, 16_Verse:
All flesh together hasted, And fell down upon their faces to the earth:
To worship before the Most High; Before the Holy One of Israel.
text.2_Chapter, 14_Verse: In the day of affliction it shall be remembered unto thee, As heat upon hoar frost, to do away thine iniquities.
text.12_Chapter, 0_Verse: Whoso toucheth pitch, it shall cleave to his hand (?); And he that hath fellowship with a scorner will learn his way.
text.3_Chapter, 19_Verse: My son, observe season and time (?); And fear evil, and be not shamefaced unto thyself.
text.31_Chapter, 19_Verse: Go not in a way set with snares; And stumble not at an offence twice.
text.12_Chapter, 24_Verse: Good is wealth, if it be without iniquity; And evil is poverty in the mouth of arrogancy.
text.6_Chapter, 18_Verse: Despise (or Reject) not a wise wife; Seeing she is well-favoured above rubies.
text.11_Chapter, 6_Verse: Give to the good, and withhold from the evil; Honour the humble, and give not to the proud.
text.4_Chapter, 19_Verse: Little or much do not corruptly (H); And instead of a friend become not an enemy.
text.2_Chapter, 29_Verse: Waters quench flaming fire; So righteousness maketh atonement for sin.
text.37_Chapter, 23_Verse: How shall he get wisdom that holdeth the plough (or goad), And glorieth in the stimulant (?) spear?
text.15_Chapter, 1_Verse: Yea, and if they increase, delight (?) not in them; If the fear of the Lord be not with them.
text.49_Chapter, 21_Verse:
Now bless ye the Lord, the God of Israel, Which doeth wonderously in the land.
That bringeth up man from the womb; And maketh him according to his will.
text.34_Chapter, 11_Verse: Fill Sion with thy majesty; And thy temple from thy glory.
text.5_Chapter, 22_Verse: A potter's vessel is for the furnace to bake (?); And like unto it, a man is according to his thought.
text.12_Chapter, 25_Verse: The heart of a man changeth his countenance; Whether for good or for evil.
text.5_Chapter, 16_Verse: For as he is, so is his neighbour; And as his name, so are his works.
text.15_Chapter, 21_Verse: Work of right who shall declare unto him? And of what is there hope, that I should be righteous (?)â€¦?
text.15_Chapter, 6_Verse: Seeing that he forgave not the princes of old time, Who ruled (?) the world by their power.
text.50_Chapter, 20_Verse: My inward parts were hot (?) as an oven for her, to behold her; Therefore I possessed her as a good possession.
text.31_Chapter, 1_Verse: That thou mayest rejoice in their honour; And receive favour at the table (?).
text.13_Chapter, 20_Verse: That setteth his heart upon her ways; And considereth her paths (S).
text.6_Chapter, 16_Verse: Be not in haste to say, A breach (?) is upon me; Commit thyself unto God, and delight in his way.
text.2_Chapter, 21_Verse: What thou art permitted, think thereupon; But thou hast no business with the secret things.
text.31_Chapter, 20_Verse: Trust not in the way of the spoiler (?); And be watchful of thy latter end.
text.37_Chapter, 8_Verse: My son, in sickness be not negligent (?): Pray unto God, for he will heal.
text.2_Chapter, 16_Verse: My son, in thy wealth walk in meekness (H S); And thou shalt be more beloved than he that giveth gifts.
text.6_Chapter, 25_Verse: Hast thou a wife? abominate (H) her not; Hast thou one that is hated? trust her not.
text.14_Chapter, 6_Verse: Men of naught shall not attain unto her; And men of arrogancy shall not see her (H S).
text.3_Chapter, 9_Verse: And God shall call thee Son; And shall be gracious to thee, and deliver thee from the pit.
text.15_Chapter, 23_Verse: Hearken unto me, and receive my proverbs (?); And set your heart upon my words.
text.14_Chapter, 10_Verse: Say not, My transgression was of God; For that which he hateth he made not (H S).
text.37_Chapter, 0_Verse: Honour a physician before need of him (H): Him also hath God apportioned.
text.6_Chapter, 20_Verse: Love a wise servant as thyself: Withhold not liberty from him.
text.31_Chapter, 5_Verse:
As a collar of gold wherein are emerald and sapphire; So are fine words comely at a banquet of wine.
As settings of fine gold and a seal of carbuncle, Is the voice of music with the pleasance of mead.
text.5_Chapter, 14_Verse: There is no exchange for a faithful friend; Nor price that can be weighed for his goodness.
text.2_Chapter, 28_Verse: A wise heart will understand parables of the wise; And the ear that hearkeneth to wisdom shall rejoice.
text.13_Chapter, 25_Verse: And he will set his nest on her bough; And will lodge in her branches.
text.15_Chapter, 20_Verse: If I have sinned, no eye shall see me; Or if I deal falsely in any secret place (?), who shall know?
text.4_Chapter, 11_Verse: Trust not on riches of falsehood; For they shall not profit in the day of wrath.
text.6_Chapter, 21_Verse: Hast thou a beast? see that thine eye be upon it (?); And if it be trusty (?), keep it.
text.6_Chapter, 19_Verse: Evil entreat not a servant that laboureth truly (?); Nor a hireling that giveth his soul (?).
text.3_Chapter, 0_Verse: My son, mock not at the life of the poor (or of affliction); And make not the soul of him that is poor and bitter of soul (H) to pine.
text.50_Chapter, 21_Verse: The Lord gave me the reward of my lips; And with my tongue will I give him thanks.
text.33_Chapter, 8_Verse: In all thy works (H) shew a bright countenance; And dedicate thy tithe with gladness.
text.14_Chapter, 17_Verse: The wisdom of the Lord aboundeth: He is mighty in power, and beholdeth all.
text.15_Chapter, 19_Verse: Surely upon me he will not set his heart; And my ways who will consider?
text.3_Chapter, 11_Verse: They that love her love life; And they that seek her shall obtain favour from the Lord.
text.13_Chapter, 14_Verse: Shalt thou not leave thy riches to another; And thy labour to them that cast lots?
text.34_Chapter, 0_Verse: Save us, O God of all; And exalt thy fear over all the nations.
text.34_Chapter, 18_Verse: A woman will receive every man (?); Yet is one woman beautiful (M). *******
text.37_Chapter, 12_Verse: For there is a time when in his hand is good success (?): For he too will supplicate unto God,
text.12_Chapter, 5_Verse: Hath he need of thee? then he will toy with thee (?); And he will smile upon thee, and encourage thee.
text.11_Chapter, 3_Verse: A double portion of evil shalt thou obtain in time of need By all the good thou shalt have brought him.
text.2_Chapter, 15_Verse: For he that despiseth his father doeth presumptuously; And he that curseth his mother angereth his Creator.
text.12_Chapter, 1_Verse:
What is too heavy for thee wherefore shouldest thou lift? And wherefore have fellowship with one that is richer than thou?
What fellowship shall earthen pot have with kettle, When if this smite that, it is dashed in pieces?
What fellowship shall the rich have with the poor?
text.15_Chapter, 22_Verse: They that want understanding will think such things; And a perverse man (?) will imagine this.
text.31_Chapter, 4_Verse:
As a seal upon a purse of gold, Is a hymn to God at a banquet of wine.
As a boss (?) of ruby on a circlet (M) of gold, Is a concert of music (?) at a banquet of wine.
text.29_Chapter, 24_Verse: Rejoice thy soul, and make thine heart joyful (?); And put vexation far from thee:
text.3_Chapter, 13_Verse: Ministers of holiness are her ministers; And God loveth them that love her (?).
text.37_Chapter, 15_Verse: My son, let tears fall over the dead: Be in bitterness, and wail with lamentation.
text.3_Chapter, 21_Verse: Have not respect of thine own person; And stumble (H) not at thine offences.
text.13_Chapter, 17_Verse:
As leaves grow upon a green tree, Whereof one withereth, and another springeth up;
So of the generations of flesh and blood, One perisheth, and another ripeneth (M).
text.33_Chapter, 10_Verse:
For he is a God that recompenseth; And sevenfold will he return unto thee.
He that giveth to the poor lendeth to the Lord; And who is a rewarder but he (M S)?
text.12_Chapter, 2_Verse: The rich doeth a wrong, and he boasteth himself of it (?): The poor is wronged, and he must entreat withal (?).
text.3_Chapter, 7_Verse: Save the oppressed from his oppressors; And let not thy spirit loathe right judgement.
text.5_Chapter, 4_Verse: Many a friend doth a sweet palate make; And gracious lips that greet (?) with peace.
text.4_Chapter, 17_Verse: Be not called a double dealer; And with thy tongue slander not a neighbour.
text.49_Chapter, 3_Verse: Who took thought for his people against the spoiler; And fortified his city against the besieger.
text.29_Chapter, 19_Verse: So whoso hath wealth, And enjoyeth not of his substance (?).
text.2_Chapter, 13_Verse: Benefaction to a father shall not be blotted out; But it shall be planted instead of sin.
text.14_Chapter, 1_Verse: And she shall meet him as mother; And receive him as wife of youth.
text.12_Chapter, 23_Verse: When the poor speaketh, Who is this? say they; And if he stumble, they will help to overthrow him.
text.3_Chapter, 16_Verse: And what time his heart is filled with me; I will turn and direct him, And reveal unto him of my secrets.
text.14_Chapter, 9_Verse: By the mouth of the wise shall praise be spoken; And he that mastereth her (H S) shall learn it.
text.5_Chapter, 30_Verse: Thou shalt put her on as robes of honour; And crown thyself with her as a crown of beauty.
text.13_Chapter, 2_Verse: Wealth is not comely for a little heart; And fine gold is not comely for one whose eye is evil.
text.48_Chapter, 11_Verse: And they erected the holy temple; Which was prepared for everlasting glory.
text.30_Chapter, 10_Verse:
Who hath blessed it (?), and made his life perfect? I will be a glory unto thee (?).
Who was able to stray, and strayed not? And to do evil to a neighbour, and would not?
text.11_Chapter, 4_Verse: Weapons of war (H S) give not to him; Wherefore should he fight with them against thee?
text.15_Chapter, 0_Verse: Desire not the shapeliness of vain youths; And rejoice not in sons of wickedness.
text.12_Chapter, 7_Verse: Take heed that thou be not urgent (?) overmuch; And be not like to them that lack intelligence.
text.2_Chapter, 25_Verse: Many are the sorrows of a hard heart; And he that is confident addeth iniquity to iniquity.
text.11_Chapter, 18_Verse: When he cometh with thee, he will not bewray himself unto thee;
text.31_Chapter, 21_Verse:
Trust not in the way of the wicked; And be ware in thy paths.
In all thy ways keep thy soul; For whoso doeth these things keepeth a commandment.
text.29_Chapter, 11_Verse:
Beat his shoulder while it is yet tender (?); Bruise (?) his loins while he is yet a youth.
Bow down his head in his youth; And smite through his loins when he is a little one.
Wherefore should he harden himself (M), and rebel against thee; That thou shouldest have (?) faintness of spirit because of him?
text.30_Chapter, 6_Verse: For it is a stumblingblock to the fool; And whoso is simple is enticed thereby.
text.4_Chapter, 9_Verse: Make no tarrying to turn unto him; And put not off (?) from day to day.
text.34_Chapter, 6_Verse: Hasten the end, and visit (H) the appointed time (?); For who shall say unto thee, What doest thou?
text.5_Chapter, 1_Verse: Fall not into the hand of thine appetite; That it should consume thy strength like an ox (?).
text.4_Chapter, 5_Verse: Say not, The Lord is merciful; And he will blot out all mine iniquities.
text.10_Chapter, 33_Verse: And estrange thee to them that are dear to thee.
text.13_Chapter, 11_Verse: Remember that there is no luxury in Sheol; And death doth not tarry; And the decree of Sheol (?) hath not been declared to thee.
text.50_Chapter, 22_Verse: Turn unto me, O foolish ones; And lodge in my house of learning.
text.15_Chapter, 5_Verse: In the congregation of the wicked a fire burneth; And in an ungodly nation wrath is kindled.
text.3_Chapter, 2_Verse: Trouble not the bowels of him that is humbled; And pain not the inward part of the poor.
text.37_Chapter, 2_Verse: The skill of a physician shall lift up his head; And he shall stand before nobles.
text.15_Chapter, 11_Verse: According to the greatness of his mercy, so is his correction; He will judge each according to his doings.
text.12_Chapter, 14_Verse: The kind of all flesh consorteth therewith; And a man will have fellowship with his kind.
text.50_Chapter, 6_Verse: And I turned around, and there was none that helped me; And I looked for one that would succour, and there was none.
text.34_Chapter, 2_Verse: As thou hast been sanctified in their eyes over us; So in our eyes get thee honour over them.
text.2_Chapter, 24_Verse: A hard heart shall fare ill at the last; But he that loveth good things will guide himself therein.
text.6_Chapter, 11_Verse: Devise not injury against a brother; And likewise neither against a companion nor a neighbour.
text.50_Chapter, 4_Verse: From cunning lips, and weavers of lies; And the arrows of a deceitful tongue.
text.30_Chapter, 11_Verse: Therefore his good is sure; And the congregation shall declare his praise. *******
text.13_Chapter, 3_Verse: He that stinteth (?) himself gathereth for another; And a stranger shall revel (?) in his goods.
text.6_Chapter, 22_Verse: Hast thou sons? instruct them; And marry wives to them in their youth.
text.3_Chapter, 14_Verse: He that heareth me shall judge truth (G nations); And he that giveth ear to me shall dwell in my chamber within.
text.29_Chapter, 25_Verse: For sorrow hath slain many; And there is no profit in vexation.
text.29_Chapter, 20_Verse: With his eye     .     .     .     .     . As an eunuch (?) embraceth a maiden and groaneth.
text.5_Chapter, 24_Verse: Incline thy shoulder, and carry her; And loathe not her cords (?).
text.49_Chapter, 8_Verse: In (or As) a gold plated vessel, and a chalice (or weighty), That is set with pleasant stones.
text.50_Chapter, 2_Verse:
Out of the snare of them that watched for my halting (?); And from the hand of them that sought my life.
From many troubles thou hast saved me; And from chokings of flaming fire..
text.31_Chapter, 16_Verse:
A man of violence (M) will wrest reproofs; And will draw the law (?) after his need.
A wise man will not conceal wisdom (M); And a scorner will not keep his tongue.
text.49_Chapter, 17_Verse: And the choir uttered its voice; And over the multitude they made sweet melody (?).
text.37_Chapter, 22_Verse: The wisdom of the scribe increaseth wisdom (H); And he that hath little business shall become wise.
text.13_Chapter, 19_Verse: Happy is the man that shall meditate in wisdom; And shall have respect to understanding.
text.32_Chapter, 1_Verse: He that hateth the law shall not be wise; And he is moved asâ€¦tossed with tempest (?).
text.2_Chapter, 12_Verse: Yea, and though his mind fail, bear with (or help) him; And dishonour him not all the days of his life (H).
text.5_Chapter, 23_Verse: Upon the bough (?) of a tree will be its fruit; So the thought of a man is according to his mind (?).
text.50_Chapter, 17_Verse: I thought to benefit; And I would not turn when I found it (?).
text.33_Chapter, 18_Verse:
Till he render to a man his due; And a man's recompense according to his devising:
Till he plead (?) the cause of his people; And make them joyful (M) with his salvation.
text.11_Chapter, 7_Verse: A friend will not be known in prosperity; And an enemy will not be hid in adversity.
text.37_Chapter, 13_Verse: That he will prosper (H) to him the treatment (or draught), And the healing, for the sake of his (?) living.
text.5_Chapter, 9_Verse: There is a friend that is a companion at the table; But he will not be found in the day of adversity.
text.31_Chapter, 6_Verse: Speak, O young man, if thou be wanted; With compulsion if one ask thee twice or thrice.
text.30_Chapter, 2_Verse: The labour (M) of the rich is to gather (G S) wealth; And if he rest, it is to take pleasure.
text.33_Chapter, 12_Verse: He will not shew favour toward the poor; And he will hear the supplication of the afflicted.
text.50_Chapter, 32_Verse: Be the name of the Lord blessed henceforth and for ever.
text.50_Chapter, 11_Verse:
And he ransomed me from all evil; And freed me in the day of trouble.
Therefore I gave thanks, and I will sing praise; And I will bless the name of the Lord.
O give thanks unto the Lord, for he is good; For his mercy endureth for ever.
O give thanks unto the God of praises; For his mercy endureth for ever.
O give thanks unto him that keepeth Israel; For his mercy endureth for ever.
O give thanks unto him that formeth all; For his mercy endureth for ever.
O give thanks unto him that redeemeth Israel; For his mercy endureth for ever.
O give thanks unto him that gathereth the outcasts of Israel; For his mercy endureth for ever.
O give thanks unto him that buildeth his city and his sanctuary; For his mercy endureth for ever.
O give thanks unto him that maketh the horn of the house of David to bud; For his mercy endureth for ever.
O give thanks unto him that chose the sons of Zadok to be priests; For his mercy endureth for ever.
O give thanks unto the Shield of Abraham; For his mercy endureth for ever.
O give thanks unto the Rock of Isaac; For his mercy endureth for ever.
O give thanks unto the Mighty One of Jacob; For his mercy endureth for ever.
O give thanks unto him that chose Zion; For his mercy endureth for ever.
O give thanks unto the King of the kings of kings; For his mercy endureth for ever.
And he will lift up the horn of his people: A praise for all his saints; Even for the children of Israel, a people near unto him. Praise ye the Lord.
text.4_Chapter, 18_Verse: For for the thief was created shame; And sore reproach for (G S) the double dealer.
text.49_Chapter, 27_Verse:
Happy is the man that meditateth on these; And he that layeth them to his heart shall be wise.
For the fear of the Lord is life.
text.6_Chapter, 10_Verse: Despise not a man that is in bitterness of spirit; Remember that there is one that lifteth up and casteth down.
text.50_Chapter, 13_Verse: And I prayed a prayer in my youth; And I found knowledge abundantly.
text.11_Chapter, 5_Verse: For God also hateth them that are evil; And to the wicked he will repay vengeance.
text.3_Chapter, 23_Verse: For by speech wisdom is made known; And understanding by the answer of the tongue.
text.50_Chapter, 25_Verse:
And (?) bring your necks into her yoke; And let your soul take up her burden.
She is nigh to them that seek her; And he that giveth his soul findeth her.
text.29_Chapter, 15_Verse: There is no wealth above wealth of sound flesh (?); And no good above goodness of heart.
text.3_Chapter, 4_Verse: He that is bitter of spirit crieth in the anguish of his soul; And his Rock (H) shall hear the voice of his cry.
text.37_Chapter, 25_Verse: And his wakefulness is to victual (?) the stall: He setteth his heart to plough furrows.
text.15_Chapter, 8_Verse: And he spared not the people of perdition, That were dispossessed (?) in their iniquity.
text.50_Chapter, 1_Verse:
Thou hast kept back my flesh from corruption; And hast delivered my foot from the hand of Sheol.
Thou hast delivered me from the evil report of the people; From the scourge of (?) the tongue, and from the lip of them that go aside to lies.
Thou wast with me against them that rose up against me; Thou hast holpen me according to thy great mercy:
text.2_Chapter, 27_Verse: Haste not to heal the stroke of the scorner; For there is no healing it: for he is a plant of evil planting.
text.13_Chapter, 24_Verse: And he pitcheth his tent by her side; And dwelleth in good neighbourhood.
text.37_Chapter, 6_Verse: By them doth the physician assuage pain; And likewise the apothecary maketh a confection:
text.13_Chapter, 13_Verse: Refuse not the day's good cheer. But encroach not upon a brother's portion (?); And covet not the desirable things of a neighbour.
text.3_Chapter, 29_Verse: Be not called a double dealer; And slander not with (?) thy tongue.
text.49_Chapter, 1_Verse: In whose generation a cistern was digged (H); A pit (or store) like the sea (?) in its abundance.
text.37_Chapter, 16_Verse:
According to the manner of each, bury his (M their) flesh; And hide not thyself when they die (?).
Weep bitterly, and make grievous wailing; And appoint mourning accordingly (?):
A day or two because of hearsay (?); And be comforted for the sake of health (?).
text.49_Chapter, 4_Verse: How glorious was he when he looked forth from the tent; And when he went out from the house of the veil!
text.50_Chapter, 30_Verse: Hitherto are the words of Simon, son of Jesus, who is called Ben Sira.
text.29_Chapter, 14_Verse: Health of flesh (?) have I desired more than fine gold; And a joyful spirit more than rubies.
text.31_Chapter, 12_Verse:
And for all these things (?) bless thy Maker; Which satisfieth thee with his goodness.
He that seeketh God may expect favour (?); And he that is a madman shall be snared thereby (?).
text.5_Chapter, 13_Verse: A faithful friend is a firm friend; And he that findeth him hath found a treasure.
text.49_Chapter, 6_Verse: And as the sun dawning upon (?) the temple of the King; And as rainbow seen in the cloud.
text.34_Chapter, 1_Verse: Shake thy hand (M) over the strange people; And let them see thy mighty acts.
text.14_Chapter, 0_Verse: For he that feareth the Lord shall do this; And he that layeth hold on the law shall attain unto her (?).
text.3_Chapter, 3_Verse: Withhold not a gift from thy needy; And thou shalt not despise the supplications of the miserable; And thou shalt not give him place to curse thee.
text.49_Chapter, 13_Verse: Until he finished serving the altar, And arranging the fires of the Most High.
text.13_Chapter, 22_Verse: That prieth through her window; And will hearken at her doors.
text.34_Chapter, 13_Verse: Give their reward to them that wait for thee; And let thy prophets be true.
text.11_Chapter, 23_Verse: If mischief hath befallen thee, he is found there; As a man that would help, he will seek reward (or to supplant).
text.15_Chapter, 10_Verse:
And if even one stiffen (or harden) his neck; It were a marvel should he be unpunished.
For mercy and wrath are with him; And he forgiveth and pardoneth; But upon the wicked his indignation shall rest (?).
text.14_Chapter, 2_Verse: And she shall feed him with bread of wisdom; And give him water of understanding to drink.
text.14_Chapter, 12_Verse: Wickedness and an abomination the Lord hateth; And will not let it befal them that fear him.
text.31_Chapter, 15_Verse:
He that feareth the Lord shall discern judgement; And shall bring forth counsels from twilight (H).
They that fear the Lord shall discern his judgement; And they shall bring forth much wisdom (M) from their heart.
text.37_Chapter, 1_Verse: From God a physician getteth wisdom; And from a king he shall receive gifts.
text.29_Chapter, 22_Verse: Give not thy soul to sorrow; And stumble not by thine iniquity (M counsel).
text.37_Chapter, 20_Verse: Remember him not, for there is no hope for him; What shalt thou profit him (?)? and thou shalt hurt thyself.
text.13_Chapter, 9_Verse:
The eye of him that hath an evil eye (?) is grudging (G) of bread; And there is famine at his table.
An evil (S) eye lavishing bread Is as a fountain dried up that should well with water (?).
text.30_Chapter, 0_Verse: The wakefulness (M) of the rich wasteth his flesh; His care (M) dissipateth slumber.
text.15_Chapter, 25_Verse: When God created his works from the beginning; According to their parts (H life) â€¦. **;*;*;*;*
text.6_Chapter, 13_Verse: Prate (?) not (or Be not familiar) in a congregation of princes; And repeat (?) not a word in prayer.
text.2_Chapter, 19_Verse: For great is the mercy of God; And he revealeth his secret to the meek.
text.6_Chapter, 24_Verse: Give away a daughter, and away with a trouble (?); But join her to a man of understanding.
text.14_Chapter, 7_Verse: Far is she from scorners; And liars shall not remember her.
text.50_Chapter, 23_Verse: How long shall ye lack these things, And your soul be very thirsty?
text.2_Chapter, 11_Verse: My son, be stedfast in honouring thy father; And forsake him not all the days of thy life.
text.31_Chapter, 3_Verse: In a place for wine pour not forth talk; And in a place for music (?) pour not forth talk: And wherefore shouldest thou be always (S) wise?
text.3_Chapter, 12_Verse: And they that retain her shall find honour from the Lord; And shall have grace shewed them by the blessing of the Lord.
text.29_Chapter, 18_Verse: What can it profit idols of the nations, Which eat not, neither do they smell?
text.4_Chapter, 8_Verse: For mercy and anger are with him; And his displeasure shall rest upon (?) the wicked.
text.30_Chapter, 7_Verse: Blessed is the man (H) that hath been found perfect; And that hath not gone aside after mammon.
text.11_Chapter, 19_Verse: And if thou fall, thou shalt not be able (S) to deliver thyself (?).
text.11_Chapter, 17_Verse: He shall not escape, until a fire be kindled in him.
text.3_Chapter, 30_Verse: Be not boastful with thy tongue; And slack and negligent (?) in thy business.
text.34_Chapter, 4_Verse: Renew signs, and repeat wonders; Glorify thy hand, and strengthen arm and right hand.
text.2_Chapter, 20_Verse: Search not the things that are too wonderful for thee; And seek not that which is hid from thee.
text.50_Chapter, 31_Verse: The Wisdom of Simon, son of Jesus, son of Eleazar, son of Sira.
text.13_Chapter, 1_Verse: Happy is the man whose soul hath not reproached (H failed) him; And whose expectation hath not ceased.
text.4_Chapter, 13_Verse: Be assured in thine own mind; And let thy word be one.
text.15_Chapter, 9_Verse: So were the six hundred thousand footmen, That were taken away in the arrogancy of their heart.
text.14_Chapter, 3_Verse: And he shall be stayed upon her, and shall not be moved; And in her shall he trust, and he shall not be confounded.
text.11_Chapter, 10_Verse: And even though he hearken to thee, and go crouching; Give thy heart to fear him.
text.37_Chapter, 4_Verse: Was not water made sweet with wood, For to acquaint every man with his (M their) power?
text.4_Chapter, 1_Verse: Stay not upon thy force; To go after the desire of thy soul.
text.50_Chapter, 5_Verse: And my soul drew near unto death; And my life to Sheol beneath.
text.15_Chapter, 4_Verse: Many things like these hath mine eye seen; And mighty things like these (H) hath mine ear heard.
text.29_Chapter, 17_Verse: Goodness poured upon a mouth that is closed Is as an offering laid before a gravestone (?).
text.14_Chapter, 18_Verse: The eyes of God see his works; And he will take knowledge of (?) all a man's doing.
text.50_Chapter, 3_Verse: From flames of a fire not blown (?); From the womb of the deep....
text.6_Chapter, 3_Verse: Justify not thyself before God (H a king); And before a king profess not understanding.
text.34_Chapter, 9_Verse: Have mercy upon the people that is called by thy name; Israel, whom thou didst surname Firstborn.
text.5_Chapter, 2_Verse: It shall eat thy leaves and uproot thy fruit; And leave thee like a dry tree.
text.4_Chapter, 3_Verse: Say not, Who can withstand my (G S) strength? For the Lord avengeth (H seeketh) them that are persecuted.
text.11_Chapter, 12_Verse: Make him not to stand beside thee: Wherefore should he thrust thee away, and stand in thy place?
text.12_Chapter, 26_Verse: A token of a merry heart is a bright countenance; And study and meditation is wearisome thought (?).
text.50_Chapter, 16_Verse: Her yoke (?) was a glory to me; And to my teacher will I give thanks.
text.4_Chapter, 14_Verse: Be swift to give ear; And with patience of spirit return answer.
text.11_Chapter, 1_Verse: Do good to the righteous, and find recompense; If not from him, from the Lord.
text.5_Chapter, 35_Verse: And let thy mind be upon the fear of the Most High; And meditate (?) in his commandments continually.
text.2_Chapter, 17_Verse: Minish thy soul from all the great things of the world; And before God thou shalt find mercy.
text.3_Chapter, 5_Verse: Make thyself (?) beloved of the congregation; And to a potentate moreover bow the head.
text.50_Chapter, 12_Verse:
I was a youth; And I delighted in her, and sought her.
My foot trod in her truth; O my Lord, from my youth I learned wisdom.
text.14_Chapter, 5_Verse: He shall find joy and gladness; And she shall cause him to inherit an everlasting name.
text.5_Chapter, 19_Verse: Rough is she to the fool; And he that is void of understanding cannot bear her.
text.15_Chapter, 14_Verse: The Lord hardened the heart of Pharaoh, who knew him not:
text.37_Chapter, 21_Verse: When the dead is at rest, let his remembrance rest; And be comforted when his soul departeth.
text.3_Chapter, 32_Verse: Let not thine hand be opened to receive; And clenched in the midst of giving.
text.34_Chapter, 8_Verse: Gather all the tribes of Jacob; And let them inherit as in the days of old.
text.34_Chapter, 3_Verse: And let them know as we have known, That there is no God but thou.
text.11_Chapter, 22_Verse: And even though an enemy weep with his eyes; When he hath found a season, he will not be satiated with blood.
text.15_Chapter, 2_Verse:
Trust not in their life, and rely not on their issues (?);
For they shall not have a good end.
For better is one that doeth acceptably than a thousand; And he that dieth childless than he that hath many sons of wickedness (?) ; And than an ungodly posterity.
text.11_Chapter, 15_Verse: Who will pity (?) a charmer that is stung; Or anyone that cometh nigh to a ravenous beast?
text.49_Chapter, 24_Verse: Two nations my soul abhorreth; And the third is no people:
text.4_Chapter, 4_Verse: Say not, I have sinned, and who (?) shall do aught unto me, For God is slow to anger?
text.11_Chapter, 14_Verse: And afterwards thou shalt attain unto my words; And shalt lament at my lament.
text.49_Chapter, 0_Verse:
Great one of his brethren, and glory of his people, Was Simon, son of Johanan (H), the priest;
In whose generation the house was repaired (?); And in whose days the temple was fortified.
text.34_Chapter, 10_Verse: Have mercy upon thy holy city; Jerusalem, the place of thy dwelling.
text.13_Chapter, 10_Verse: My son, if thou hast wherewithal, minister (S) to thine own self; And if thou hast, do good unto thyself; And according to the power of âˆ¥ thy hand, make thyself fat.
text.11_Chapter, 21_Verse: With his lips will an adversary speak sweetly (G), While he deviseth deep pitfalls in his heart.
text.12_Chapter, 18_Verse: Lowliness is the abomination of pride; And the needy is the abomination of the rich.
text.49_Chapter, 11_Verse:
When he received the pieces out of the hand of his brethren; While himself standing by the altar-fires:
Round him a crown of sons, Like cedar plants in Lebanon.
And they compassed him about like willows of the brook:
All the sons of Aaron in their glory:
text.37_Chapter, 26_Verse: Likewise the artificer..... Which by night is busied (M)... *******
text.5_Chapter, 29_Verse: Her yoke (G Upon her) is an ornament (G) of gold; And her bands are thread of purple.
text.48_Chapter, 12_Verse:
Nehemiah, glorious is his memory; Who raised up our ruins:
And healed our breaches; And set up gates and bars.
text.31_Chapter, 18_Verse: Without counsel do not anything; And after thy doings vex not thyself.
text.34_Chapter, 7_Verse: Make an end of the head of the princes of Moab (H); That saith, There is none but me.
text.29_Chapter, 21_Verse: So is he that doeth judgement with violence (?). So is an eunuch (?) that lieth with a virgin. And the Lord requireth at his hand.
text.2_Chapter, 26_Verse: Without the apple of the eye light faileth; And without knowledge wisdom faileth.
text.6_Chapter, 14_Verse: Esteem not thyself among the men of thy (?) people; Remember that wrath will not tarry (?).
text.49_Chapter, 7_Verse:
As budding branch (?) in the days of the solemn feast; And as the lotus by the watercourses.
As flower of Lebanon in the days of summer; And as fire of incense upon the meal-offering:
